page.title: 01Beverley (East)
page.content: This area of Beverley is to the east and south of the town centre, the railway lines being a local boundary. In the past the Grovehill and Beckside areas of the town must have resembled busy villages which have since been swallowed up in the consequent development made necessary by a growing population. Beverley Beck is no longer a busy waterway,nor is it as badly polluted as it was in days gone by. Nowadays it is a pleasant place for a stroll. Overshadowed by the imposing Minster,this area if a mixture of terace housing, modern estate housing and large detached dwellings. Many of the families living here have long associations with this area and still regard the centre of Beverley as being "up town".
